segment.source: WIM vs. VHD vs. FFU: comparing image file formats
segment.target: WIM vs. VHD vs. FFU: comparing image file formats

segment.source: WIM vs. VHD vs. FFU: comparing image file formats
segment.target: WIM vs. VHD vs. FFU: comparing image file formats

segment.source: Comparing .WIM, .VHD/.VHDX, and .FFU: These file formats are all used to deploy Windows to new devices.
segment.target: Comparing .WIM, .VHD/.VHDX, and .FFU: These file formats are all used to deploy Windows to new devices.

segment.source: Here's how they compare:
segment.target: Here's how they compare:

segment.source: Windows image (.WIM)
segment.target: Windows image (.WIM)

segment.source: Virtual Hard Disk (.VHD/VHDX)
segment.target: Virtual Hard Disk (.VHD/VHDX)

segment.source: Full Flash Update (.FFU)
segment.target: Full Flash Update (.FFU)

segment.source: Common uses
segment.target: Common uses

segment.source: Fastest for testing and modifying Windows images.
segment.target: Fastest for testing and modifying Windows images.

segment.source: Quickly mounting and modifying images.
segment.target: Quickly mounting and modifying images.

segment.source: Easiest for deploying Windows to virtual PCs.
segment.target: Easiest for deploying Windows to virtual PCs.

segment.source: You can boot a new device directly from a single VHD/VHDX file.
segment.target: You can boot a new device directly from a single VHD/VHDX file.

segment.source: Fastest for capturing and deploying Windows on a factory floor.
segment.target: Fastest for capturing and deploying Windows on a factory floor.

segment.source: Includes built-in security to verify signed images.
segment.target: Includes built-in security to verify signed images.

segment.source: Imaging style
segment.target: Imaging style

segment.source: File-based
segment.target: File-based

segment.source: Sector-based
segment.target: Sector-based

segment.source: Sector-based
segment.target: Sector-based

segment.source: Compression
segment.target: Compression

segment.source: Supports multiple types of compression
segment.target: Supports multiple types of compression

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: What does it capture?
segment.target: What does it capture?

segment.source: A set of files, up to an entire partition.
segment.target: A set of files, up to an entire partition.

segment.source: Captures the full set of drive information, including partitions.
segment.target: Captures the full set of drive information, including partitions.

segment.source: Captures the full set of drive information, including partitions.
segment.target: Captures the full set of drive information, including partitions.

segment.source: When I apply the image, what happens?
segment.target: When I apply the image, what happens?

segment.source: Adds the files and folders to the partition.
segment.target: Adds the files and folders to the partition.

segment.source: If there are existing files and folders with the same names, they're replaced.
segment.target: If there are existing files and folders with the same names, they're replaced.

segment.source: Otherwise, the existing files are kept.
segment.target: Otherwise, the existing files are kept.

segment.source: Cleans the entire drive.
segment.target: Cleans the entire drive.

segment.source: Cleans the entire drive.
segment.target: Cleans the entire drive.

segment.source: Can I deploy to different sizes of hard drives?
segment.target: Can I deploy to different sizes of hard drives?

segment.source: Yes.
segment.target: Yes.

segment.source: Yes, though the new drive must be the same size or larger than the original.
segment.target: Yes, though the new drive must be the same size or larger than the original.

segment.source: Yes, though the new drive must be the same size or larger than the original.
segment.target: Yes, though the new drive must be the same size or larger than the original.

segment.source: Can I modify the images?
segment.target: Can I modify the images?

segment.source: Yes.
segment.target: Yes.

segment.source: With tools like DISM, you can mount, modify, and unmount the image.
segment.target: With tools like DISM, you can mount, modify, and unmount the image.

segment.source: Yes, you can mount a VHD/VHDX as if it were removable media, and modify the files.
segment.target: Yes, you can mount a VHD/VHDX as if it were removable media, and modify the files.

segment.source: Yes, though it's limited to adding packages.
segment.target: Yes, though it's limited to adding packages.

segment.source: Security
segment.target: Security

segment.source: Includes a security header and image header to identify a secured image.
segment.target: Includes a security header and image header to identify a secured image.

segment.source: Includes a catalog and hash table to validate a signature upfront before flashing onto a device.
segment.target: Includes a catalog and hash table to validate a signature upfront before flashing onto a device.

segment.source: To learn more, see /Apply-Image in DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.
segment.target: To learn more, see /Apply-Image in DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.
